message:
Dear Geeks,

I have decided to never pay any money for software ever again, I made this decision 3 years ago and so far have not paid a single pence or even paid any subscriptions to any service. All software I use is free software and I have nothing cracked.

I have also not paid for any music whatsoever, and am looking for a way to get books totally free. I currently have no trouble getting the information I need and only once 4 years ago paid for a book online.

What do you think of trying a simialr experiment? Please tell me your experiences/opinions.

BR,
MSAMY

A free geek :) A Sufi Geek :)

Mohamed Elsherif both actually, free software is free from corporate control and free to distribute and use. Not paying money means we won't support this patent/copyright crap which to me is like a thug taking part of the street and charging you for parking.  You should only pay as a donation. If someone wants me to pay money it means I have a choice to do it. I don't think we really need to pay money for software any more. We could pay for services, for processing power, for experience. But closed proprietary code is now worth 0 to me, unless I need it to make money, and at that time I will charge the customer for the software they need to pay for,

I don't agree that you should pay for software ONLY as a Donation, this doesn't make sense at all.
and believe me you are paying for software one way or another, as a matter of fact you are already paying Facebook \ Google \ YouTube ... etc the fact that these services are still running means that you are paying.

Mohamed Elsherif it makes perfect sense, not a single pence has gone from my wallet to any of the three companies or to any software company for that matter. I guess that some advertisers pay for all of us.
I predict that hardware will be free in the not so far future too btw, as companies will want more people to connect to the web and be giving it for free

It would be cool if we got back the feeling like in the early 90s when the internet was a new frontier and people wrote code because they enjoyed it. Everything you ever want can be found free, even of you can't write that level or langiage you could find it on Github. Browsers are free and material is available to learn. I Haven't found a single App on my Android I need to pay for. So what have you bought in the last 3 years?

Here is another cool idea, making a cellphone from scratch, so how hard would it be to install ubuntu touch or even Debian on a large touchscreen assembeled phone  :) No reason to pay 6000 LE for a phone any more  http://www.instructables.com/id/Make-your-own-cellphone-from-scratch/

The idea is, we have the know how, the software, the cheap tools, the freely available code. Why pay for something we can get free?? If we are charged 6000 LE for a phone then it better do something really amazing, and none of the phone's I have seen do that. So why pay Samsung? I can learn something new and save 1000s. We can even do like the chinese companies and copy  and build our own, pretty soon we will have a real flourishing industry, not like the fake startup fad we have now.

What's the point of just not paying? 
Yes you have open and free alternatives, but you have to pay time and hardware to maintain your own setups;  economically it's easier to use ready SaaS services to handle this hassle. ., there's no patents here or monopolies to worry about. . they are open source based.

..and what does that all make with sufism? This not تقشف at all

Amr Medhat no Sufi Geeks is my community, it is about people who work on software out of love or any geeky endeavour, but money is not the main goal. As for not paying, the goal is to save as much money as you can and to focus on being free of companies. SAAS is great, if you can get free accounts it is great.
Amr Medhat as for what Tassawuf is, it is not to say here or discuss here, but I have a page and many resources I could send you. PM me of that insterests you. It is a lot deeper than "taqasshuf"
Sufi geeks is kind of a mixed meaning, cause both Sufis and Geeks have a lot in common in search for knowledge :) my page is called  "Sufi Geeks"

If the goal is not money itself, what's is it? Free in FOSS means freedom with all its degrees;  not zero cost software - their value is openness not saving. .

I got your point about sufi geeks.

one of the freedoms is freedom not to be chasing your next paycheck, of you can spend less and wisely and consume less or reach even the same conveince for less. For example, if you buy a Gtide chinese phone for 800 LE and get the same features as an iPhone if not more, then why not? You can get free electricity if you use solar energy, in Egypt we have a lot of that. You can get a free holiday or next to free, if you learn to camp. I like the idea of going off the grid, my dream is to have a home in the desert and work remotely and live off the grid :)

I don't agree with your point about not paying for software/music/books or other kinds of creative work. 

If I want to get something that has good quality, someone has to build it, and maintain it. if that someone is not me, then it's someone else. S/he is spending time on that, and every human deserve to be paid in exchange for their time so they can have life as good as everyone else. 

We should care more about having a healthy market. 

Anyone can build a thing, put a price tag, and I can accept it, or refuse it and go look for another option that matches my needs and budget. And generally my budget for that software or book will depend on the expected ROI if I use it.

And as consumers, the more we have options, the better quality we will get, and for lower prices.

I don't expect everyone to agree. What I am talking about is making a free choice not to pay for software until you must absolutely have to. And if you have a problem you cannot solve for free, write your own program and make it free and open source, that way you too give back to the community.

Software is a form of knowledge currency and it makes sense to give back in the same currency.

I think in the end if you share your knoweldge Allah will reward you and it doesn't make sense to ask people for money for an idea because all ideas and knowledge come from Allah. None of us know or understand really.

In the end, if someone is making software or maintaining it and they do so because they love it, it will be great software, but doing for money produces bad software anyway in my opinion.  I am also NOT agains paying as a reward or gift to the person, but it must also be of your own free will and in donation form.
if software should be free, everything else should as well. let's escape money and live in Utopia.
Actually. nothing should be as expensive as it is, especially if you can make it yourself. If we all lay off consumption, the prices will all go down.

if all prices go down, you will pay less, but you will also earn less, so it makes no difference at all, on a national level the value of the currency or how expensive things are is completely irrelevant.
The complexity (and unfairness maybe?) comes when you look on the international level and consider exchange rates between currencies.
